comment: I wouldn't recommend this professor, as he struggles with online platforms. This makes it difficult to access materials in advance or for review. When asking questions, his responses are often unclear, and he seems frustrated. I suggest finding another professor unless you have no other option.
He just seemed all over the place. I took the class with my roommate and we both had trouble, even with each other's help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great professor! Took him for both 1101 & 1102. The class is not hard, just show up and do the work! His lectures are long and drawn out, but he knows what he is talking about. If you want you pass the quizzes, I would attend and take notes. Homework is long but helpful. Test questions typically drawn from there. Would take him again!!

He is strict, but not too bad as long as you go to class, takes notes, and listen. His test are exactly the homework questions! If you miss the quizzes they can kill your grade so just go. And he lectures are boring

Loved this class. It was very obvious that he cared deeply for this subject and was passionate about it. Go to class, take notes, do your homework and it's an easy A. He gave out extra points to those who came on nights when hardly any other students showed up. It's what helped get me an A. Would definitely recommend him to anyone.

Super easy. Don't ask questions in class though, because then he will go off on some random tangent and when he assigns the pop quiz @ the end, you won't have learned what you needed to in order to pass. Attendance isn't mandatory, he does have a make up day for quizzes and tests, but only if you have a doctor's note or other valid proof.

He makes his class as easy as he can make it without it being a hand out grade. You can tell he loves his job. 3 exams, 10 pop quizzes (which were easy and at the end of each power point) and MES homework that are all opened at the beginning of the semester and they arent closed until the last day. TAKE HIM.

Mr. Krolak was a very good teacher. He is an absolute genius and is very passionate about what he talks about. Lectures can get a little bit long and boring but the class is very straight forward. Would definitely take him again.

He was a good professor, and his test were pretty easy. He does have pop quizzes (usually one per chapter) that can make or break your grade. For the most part, I would recommend him. Homework can take hours, but the test questions are directly from the homework. He also sends out sample test questions. I would definitely recommend him.
Easy. didn't even go to class. didn't assign homework this year. tests are weird, but more or less common sense. easy a or at least a b.

As long as you do the homework assigned before each test, it is really easy. Pop Quizzes, but they are not difficult. Lectures can be kind of boring, but he is an interesting guy if you are into science.

Krolak is one of the easiest science teachers, if you study, do the homework, and attend class. Although lectures are long and boring, doing the homework (which is due at the end of the semester) will prepare you for each test. 3 exams, final is the 3rd exam not cumulative. DO THE HOMEWORK- the questions from it are on the test.

Dr. Krolak works part time at the CDC in Atlanta and is very intelligent. He has views that do not always match up with the course but that does not interfere too much with the way that the material is gone over. 3 tests and a good deal of online homework.

Easy class. Doesn't allow laptops or tape recording. Very opinionated and if you question him, he'll just say how he knows more than everyone in the classroom combined. It will be p. obvious what his political beliefs are like not believing in climate change despite teaching an environmental science course. If you have to take him, you can get an A

If you can keep your eyes open in class and take notes, you'll get an A. He's super boring. (All the random stuff he talks about are always bonus questions). He also gives out pop quizzes and is kind of rude occasionally. But, if you put a little effort in, you'll get an A.

Easy class he gives long lectures and has 10 pop quizzes so choose the class you are going to go to. However he does offer 20 extra credit points on every test and the test is just the homework questions on the  study the HW and you will get over a 100.

He is not as hard as they all say. DO THE HW & STUDY THE HW QUESTIONS even though there are over 250. HW questions are the exact same questions that appear on the test verbatim. Do that and you will get a 105 on the test. Pop quizzes are 20% of grade & I got a 70 on it but the 3 tests and the HW make up the other 80 percent and that will get u an A

Take this professor if there are no other good choices. The homework is very long and make sure you do the chapter homework for the test its over. DO NOT WAIT TILL LAST MINUTE because the homework is very long. Some of the homework questions will help with the test too.

Class was easy. 3 tests, 5 POP quizzes and 13 HW's. Do the homework, and print out the questions and answers and just read over them (Identical to the test.) Only went to a few classes for the quizzes and tests. Usually gave quiz out every 3-4 classes but would never tell you in advance. Got an A. Unless you're incredibly lazy, you won't fail.

I enjoyed having him. He is very experienced. His class lectures are very relevant and interesting. He does not allow cell phones in class. There are 5 pop quizzes that total 20% of your grade, which I got a 70 avg on. However, if you do and study the Homework, you will ace the tests. That will can earn you an A , regardless of your quiz grades.

Good lecturer. Tests have lots of easy questions but the make sure you study the labs. Curves tests. Everyone fails the pop quizzes, they're impossible.  I attended every class and my pop quiz average was an F but my test average was an A plus. Lots of homework but its due at end of semester. Don't take this class if you need an A.

I dreaded the first day but to my surprise, the more I came to class&listened to the information ( which he knows VERY well) I somehow got interested in it, but i had to try. If you try, and actually listen and appreciate his love and knowledge for the subject, you wont be bored. And for tests, just do the hw(its word 4 word) , I got all 100s !!

Great Professor! I really enjoyed his class because his lectures were always interesting. His pop quizzes are the only reason I didn't get an A in both of his classes. I went to class like every other day and it was a pretty easy class. Just do the homework and review the powerpoint slides before the test and you will end up with an A or B.

NO use of electronics, he will kick you out. Also do not get up and leave, he will make it into a big disruption lecture. PPs are all online. Pop quizzes (usually the 2nd or 3rd day of notes) tests are almost 90 multiple chioce questions with 10 or more bonus. Havent read a single lab and have passed all tests by revewing pp and skimming the labs

The only professor I have ever had that doesn't allow students to use their laptops or any type of electronic device to take notes, somebody should wake this moron up its 2015!!!!  How can you have an online curriculum that requires your homework to be turned in online but doesn't allow technology in class. I just wanna take notes guy!!!!!!

Great Professor, really wants all to pass but you have to put in the work.  Attendance isn't mandatory by you need to be there.  He give 10 pop quizzes and 3 large test.  The test are tricky cause of his wording. I received an B in the class but I had to really work for it.  He's very approachable guy and sweet just NO CELL phones in class.
Great professor! Provides all the tools to be successful in class. Make sure you complete and study the homework, it will help you to get an A in the test.

Dr. Krolak is very knowledgeable and passionate about so many areas in environmental science.  He is one of the few instructors who doesn't believe in man-made global warming. He's fair and he cares about the students. Take him.

Ridiculously easy class. Attendance isn't mandatory but there are random pop quizzes. He drops no-so-subtle hints that things will be on the quizzes or tests. Tests are super easy. Basically have a pulse and care about your grade and you will get an A. Side note: He tends to go off on political tangents. Kindof obnoxious.

Professor Krolak is such a nice guy who will go way out of his way to explain something or even simply chit chat after class about anything you need to. He really values his work and his students. You have to be straight up LAZY not to make an A in one of his classes. Do your online homework before the test+show up to classsolid A. Take him!

You can get amazing grades on the test with little studying, but even if you go to class every day you will fail multiple pop quizzes. He's a good guy, but it's like his quizzes are designed to bring your grade down.
Environmental science teacher that doesn't believe in climate change..... super nice and easy tester though. has several pop-quizzes but drops lowest grade. four tests,  non-cumulative final
Nice but seems disconnected at times

He is a fair professor. He is very angry though...I really liked him, he told interesting stories...But he would get inappropriately angry at his students..granted they provoked it, but that much hostility in the classroom interrupts my learning. Just respect his rules, study the chapters and go to class and you can achieve an A.

Not a particularly fun class but this professor made all the difference. This man is a true professional who is passionate about what he does, dedicates his spare time to learning more about his field, and is willing to step out of his way to help his students learn more about environmental science. He is a pleasure to know and a true inspiration.

if you have to take his class, it won't be the end of the world but I definitely do not think he is the best science professor at ksu. The tests were hard and there were 10 pop quizzes that brought my grade down. in the end I had a 79 and he bumped me to a B. You definitely have to work for an A.
Tough professor, comes off as being hard but cares about his students and the material which over time warms students up to him.

SUPER hard teacher. He gives pop quizzes at the end of class randomly that are super hard. His pop quizzes are his way of taking attendance. His tests are straight forward and out of the book/lecture. Too hard for a core class.

He gives pop quizzes every week that are extremely hard even if you go to class and look over the power points. His tests are fairly easy as long as you study the material. This class was too hard for a general education course.

A lot of people don't like Prof. Krolak very much, but I enjoyed him. Passionate about what he teaches. Gives pop quizzes, so just make sure to go to class. No cumulative final, just 3 tests; study w/ your book for those. Bonus pts on random things he says in lectures, so if he repeats something, write it down. Just read the book & you'll make an A
Good teacher and tests are pretty easy

Attendance is pretty almost mandatory even though he says it's not. He gives random pop quizzes that count toward the grade at the end of class. PowerPoints are lengthy but they cover what is on the test. He knows the subject well and gets sidetracked with other stories. Don't use any tech devices or you will get called out in class.

I don't know why so many people said his tests/quizzes have nothing to do with his lectures. Tests have EVERYTHING to do with the powerpoints! Sure, the class is boring. But if you read over the powerpoint slides, the tests are word for word from the slides & he gives bonus questions in class to know. Read the notes, you get an A. Don't, you fail.

A lot of people complain, but its not difficult if you study the textbook vocab & power points on D2L, and attend the SI sessions. Don't just memorize stuff, make sure you have a comprehensive knowledge of the material because you have to apply concepts to questions on the test. Don't talk in his class. Ask specific questions. Go to every class.

The worst professor I've had my whole college career. His tests have nothing to do with his PowerPoints that he lectures from. I take notes, study and attend class meetings and still clueless,come test time. He is rude and hostile. Doesn't respond to emails. He is horrible. Unfortunately, I  have nothing positive to say about Krolak.
Test have nothing to do with what we learn in class!!!! I always take notes in class and read and do hw and when i get the test im like what!?!?!

this class was awful.  he rambles about his powerpoints and goes off topic. tests contain none of the material from class.  he is really rude to the students, and unless you go to all of the SI sessions provided you are going to get 70's on the test and 50's on pop quizzes.  I wouldn't take him but its nothe end of the world if you do.

This professor is very rude. His opinion is the only opinion that matters.  If you refuse to leave class because you have your cell phone out, he will call 911. He will publicly humiliate you if you contradict him. He goes off on his own tangents about unrelated subject matter. Stay far away from this professor!

The way he sets up the class is complicated but once you understand his way of doing things it becomes much easier. He's very sensitive to student activity so don't expect to be able to talk, move, or anything else other than take notes. Other than this he has done a remarkable job of educating me given the ridiculous size of the class. (200)
Anyone with sleeping disorder are welcome to his class.... He'll put you to sleep in no time... Avoid!!

Krolak is very rude to all his students, always grumpy. He is monotone and his class is so boring. The tests are hard bec nothing you talk about in class is on it. The book is more useful than his lectures. Pop quizzes so you have to go to class. Only thing that is easy is the online hw. Take someone else.
Do not take the class. He seems like a good guy but Im not in school to make friends. The quizzes are difficult because the questions relate to the stories about his personal life.

Great professor. Gives a ton of bonus points and every time I thought I failed the test I would make A's because of the bonus questions. He is a lot better than the other 1101 and 1102 professors at Kennesaw. Take him.

He knows his material very well and is extremely passionate about this subject. Attendance is not mandatory, but his way of 'attendance' is pop quizzes. There are 10 throughout the semester. 3 big tests, no cumulative final, does assign online homework (which is time consuming but easy!). He does a lot of lecturing.

I took Krolak for 1101 and I am currently in 1102. He's knowledgeable and all, yeah that's great, but his "knowledge" is stories that are irrelevant and drawn out. He is extremely rude to all his students and just cranky in general. He doesnt teach, the powerpoints do. He's a mean guy, but his class is pretty easy, dont lean on him, do it yourself.

many students said Dr. Krolak is boring or not interesting, but I am disagree. He is a veteran, and works for CDC currently. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about whathe teaches. He cares about the success of his students. He is the BEST teacher I ever had.

Professor Krolak is very knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. He also cares a ton about the success of his students. He is always willing to help out however he can. If you go to class, take some notes, you'll get an A.

This professor is extremely knowledgeable about the material, but he doesn't have the best teaching skills. However, if you put time into the class  by going to class everyday, taking good notes, studying, and doing the online work and labs, you will probably do well.

The lectures are not interesting and I wanted to fall asleep in every class. I emailed him 3 times in one week and he never responded to any of them. Class is not mandatory but he does give pop quizzes. The tests are really long and they have graphs on them that were never taught during class time. Also, he is extremely against texting in class.

Many may say he is boring, or he is monotone, but i disagree, he is a veteran of our armed forces, and works for the federal government currently.  He offers a much needed bias on the college campus of our political mindset.  He may be blunt at times, but mostly when people are sleeping, or on their cell phones.
Very nice guy. Knows his stuff. Do the labs. Show up to class and pay attention because he gives you some bonus questions for the tests. lectures can be a bit boring. I hate science and i made an A
Very nice professor! Lots of very interesting information. Take notes and look over powerpoints. DO THE LABS!
Great professor. Has a lot of information and knowledge.  Classes are long so be prepared.

This class was painful in that excruciatingly boring way. The professor's voice is droning and  definitely made me wanna fall asleep. He was horrible at doing what he said he would do. The program the course uses was often messed up due to his schedule and he had no idea what his slides were about until he pulled it up that class :/

Great professor. His personal knowledge kept the class interesting. Print power points and take notes for tests. He does not put up with anything so do not test him. Some people were disrespectful and yes he will call you on it!But if you respect him he will respect you!

I thought he was a great professor.  He does keep you on your toes and does not put up with anything.  BUT I enjoyed his class. Advice - print power points and take notes.  His tests are lengthy but the extra credits can make up a great deal of points on the test.  Great Professor!

Excellent instructor. Extremely knowledgeable about so many different topics. He made things extremely clear and understanding. He shared his personal experiences that helped me to better understand and appreciate what he was talking about. He was extremely respectful to students, You can tell he cares about them.

Great professor! Very knowledgable and extremely helpful if you need to ask him any questions. He really cares about students and wants everyone to do well. He gets a little upset now and again, due in part to the majority of students not attending class. Studentd wonder why they do poorly in his class, simple answer:show up.

attended his class everyday took notes even printed the powerpoint i studied from day one!and i still ended up failing my first test so i had to withdraw bc the way he worded his test made it difficult!he is a smart man he will answer any questions you have but personally i wouldnt retake his class:/

I felt like I crammed so much for every single exam and still knew nothing. He is very disrespectful to students. I went to every class, took notes, and still did not do well on the exams. And he is painfully boring.

He is a great teacher.  Come to class and you should be fine.  He got a bad rap this semester due to one particular event where he lost his temper in class; however, it was completely warranted and understandable considering the fact that no one would listen to his instructions.  I would definitely take him again.  Nice guy and very knowledgable.

Not a bad teacher. For the most part he read straight from the powerpoints. He does have experience in the fields he teaches, which is cool. My main complaint with him is he verbally abused the entire class one day. Tarnishing the reputation of the science department at ksu. I lost all respect for him after that day. Lost my interest in the course.

I went to class every day and really enjoyed his lectures. He has taught at several universities, is incredibly smart, and well prepared for class.  Before this class I didn't care much about science and he has made it interesting.  I would definitely take him again - he's a great professor.  If you put forth an effort in his class you'll do fine.

The professor comes from a high school background and this kind of policing is prevalent throughout the class. He has blatantly demeaned and talked down to students as if they were children. The classes are not mandatory and EXTREMELY boring. He recites the power points and often drifts off on random tangents. The tests are fairly difficult
He gets frustrated very easily and tends to be rude to the students. The tests are difficult. Attendance is not mandatory. He just goes over powerpoints in class and it can get extremely boring.

It's really clear that he's used to teaching high school. He overcomplicates things and then becomes frustrated and yells at the class. He is interesting, and I don't dislike his class, but his teaching is self-centered (he admitted to it) and he seems to forget that we pay for our education. He also put the wrong e-mail address on his syllabus.
He is, at times, vocally demeaning to his class. His lectures are straight from the Power Point presentation and VERY boring. You'd learn as much, if not more, by reading the textbook.
